title: Section Of A Petticoat, 1700–50
medium:
Medium: linen embroidery, cotton cording, cotton foundation
Technique: stitched using trapunto technique; embroidered in satin, stem, coral knot, French knot, and eyelet stitches with deflected element work
creditline: Gift of Anonymous Donor from the Fraser/Martin Collection
description:
White on white pattern of symmetrical floral forms stemming from a vase.
Two layers of white cotton fabric are placed one on top of the other with warps and wefts aligned. Heavy cotton yarn is pulled through channels created by parallel rows of running stitches through both layers, giving a padded effect (trapunto). Embroidered details are added in a variety of stitches. In some areas, the back layer of fabric is cut away and deflected element work is added in the top layer.

tombstone.epitaph:
Section Of A Petticoat, 1700–50.
1700–50. Medium: linen embroidery, cotton cording, cotton foundation
Technique: stitched using trapunto technique; embroidered in satin, stem, coral knot, French knot, and eyelet stitches with deflected element work. Gift of Anonymous Donor from the Fraser/Martin Collection. 1974-100-25.
